description: Retrieves the alarms for the specified metric. To filter the results, specify a statistic, period, or unit. This operation retrieves only standard alarms that are based on the specified metric. It does not return alarms based on math expressions that use the specified metric, or composite alarms that use the specified metric.

parameters.name: Dimensions
parameters.description: The dimensions associated with the metric. If the metric has any associated dimensions, you must specify them in order for the call to succeed. (dict) --- A dimension is a name/value pair that is part of the identity of a metric. Because dimensions are part of the unique identifier for a metric, whenever you add a unique name/value pair to one of your metrics, you are creating a new variation of that metric. For example, many Amazon EC2 metrics publish InstanceId as a dimension name, and the actual instance ID as the value for that dimension. You can assign up to 30 dimensions to a metric. The name of the dimension. Dimension names must contain only ASCII characters, must include at least one non-whitespace character, and cannot start with a colon ( :). ASCII control characters are not supported as part of dimension names. The value of the dimension. Dimension values must contain only ASCII characters and must include at least one non-whitespace character. ASCII control characters are not supported as part of dimension values.

nested_params.name: Name
nested_params.description: The name of the dimension. Dimension names must contain only ASCII characters, must include at least one non-whitespace character, and cannot start with a colon ( :). ASCII control characters are not supported as part of dimension names.

nested_params.name: Value
nested_params.description: The value of the dimension. Dimension values must contain only ASCII characters and must include at least one non-whitespace character. ASCII control characters are not supported as part of dimension values.

nested_items.name: MetricAlarms
nested_items.description: The information for each alarm with the specified metric.

nested_items.name: AlarmName
nested_items.description: The name of the alarm.

nested_items.name: AlarmArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the alarm.

nested_items.name: AlarmDescription
nested_items.description: The description of the alarm.

nested_items.name: AlarmConfigurationUpdatedTimestamp
nested_items.description: The time stamp of the last update to the alarm configuration.

nested_items.name: ActionsEnabled
nested_items.description: Indicates whether actions should be executed during any changes to the alarm state.

nested_items.name: OKActions
nested_items.description: The actions to execute when this alarm transitions to the OK state from any other state. Each action is specified as an Amazon Resource Name (ARN).
(string) ---

nested_items.name: AlarmActions
nested_items.description: The actions to execute when this alarm transitions to the ALARM state from any other state. Each action is specified as an Amazon Resource Name (ARN).
(string) ---

nested_items.name: InsufficientDataActions
nested_items.description: The actions to execute when this alarm transitions to the INSUFFICIENT_DATA state from any other state. Each action is specified as an Amazon Resource Name (ARN).
(string) ---

nested_items.name: StateValue
nested_items.description: The state value for the alarm.

nested_items.name: StateReason
nested_items.description: An explanation for the alarm state, in text format.

nested_items.name: StateReasonData
nested_items.description: An explanation for the alarm state, in JSON format.

nested_items.name: StateUpdatedTimestamp
nested_items.description: The time stamp of the last update to the value of either the StateValue or EvaluationState parameters.

nested_items.name: MetricName
nested_items.description: The name of the metric associated with the alarm, if this is an alarm based on a single metric.

nested_items.name: Namespace
nested_items.description: The namespace of the metric associated with the alarm.

nested_items.name: Statistic
nested_items.description: The statistic for the metric associated with the alarm, other than percentile. For percentile statistics, use ExtendedStatistic.

nested_items.name: ExtendedStatistic
nested_items.description: The percentile statistic for the metric associated with the alarm. Specify a value between p0.0 and p100.

nested_items.name: Dimensions
nested_items.description: The dimensions for the metric associated with the alarm.

nested_items.name: Name
nested_items.description: The name of the dimension. Dimension names must contain only ASCII characters, must include at least one non-whitespace character, and cannot start with a colon ( :). ASCII control characters are not supported as part of dimension names.

nested_items.name: Value
nested_items.description: The value of the dimension. Dimension values must contain only ASCII characters and must include at least one non-whitespace character. ASCII control characters are not supported as part of dimension values.

nested_items.name: Period
nested_items.description: The period, in seconds, over which the statistic is applied.

nested_items.name: Unit
nested_items.description: The unit of the metric associated with the alarm.

nested_items.name: EvaluationPeriods
nested_items.description: The number of periods over which data is compared to the specified threshold.

nested_items.name: DatapointsToAlarm
nested_items.description: The number of data points that must be breaching to trigger the alarm.

nested_items.name: Threshold
nested_items.description: The value to compare with the specified statistic.

nested_items.name: ComparisonOperator
nested_items.description: The arithmetic operation to use when comparing the specified statistic and threshold. The specified statistic value is used as the first operand.

nested_items.name: TreatMissingData
nested_items.description: Sets how this alarm is to handle missing data points. The valid values are breaching, notBreaching, ignore, and missing. For more information, see Configuring how CloudWatch alarms treat missing data.

nested_items.name: EvaluateLowSampleCountPercentile
nested_items.description: Used only for alarms based on percentiles. If ignore, the alarm state does not change during periods with too few data points to be statistically significant. If evaluate or this parameter is not used, the alarm is always evaluated and possibly changes state no matter how many data points are available.

nested_items.name: Metrics
nested_items.description: An array of MetricDataQuery structures, used in an alarm based on a metric math expression. Each structure either retrieves a metric or performs a math expression. One item in the Metrics array is the math expression that the alarm watches. This expression by designated by having ReturnData set to true.

nested_items.name: Id
nested_items.description: A short name used to tie this object to the results in the response. This name must be unique within a single call to GetMetricData. If you are performing math expressions on this set of data, this name represents that data and can serve as a variable in the mathematical expression. The valid characters are letters, numbers, and underscore. The first character must be a lowercase letter.

nested_items.name: MetricStat
nested_items.description: The metric to be returned, along with statistics, period, and units. Use this parameter only if this object is retrieving a metric and not performing a math expression on returned data.

nested_items.name: Namespace
nested_items.description: The namespace of the metric.

nested_items.name: MetricName
nested_items.description: The name of the metric. This is a required field.

nested_items.name: Dimensions
nested_items.description: The dimensions for the metric.

nested_items.name: Name
nested_items.description: The name of the dimension. Dimension names must contain only ASCII characters, must include at least one non-whitespace character, and cannot start with a colon ( :). ASCII control characters are not supported as part of dimension names.

nested_items.name: Value
nested_items.description: The value of the dimension. Dimension values must contain only ASCII characters and must include at least one non-whitespace character. ASCII control characters are not supported as part of dimension values.

nested_items.name: Period
nested_items.description: The granularity, in seconds, of the returned data points. For metrics with regular resolution, a period can be as short as one minute (60 seconds) and must be a multiple of 60. For high-resolution metrics that are collected at intervals of less than one minute, the period can be 1, 5, 10, 30, 60, or any multiple of 60. High-resolution metrics are those metrics stored by a PutMetricData call that includes a StorageResolution of 1 second.
Start time between 3 hours and 15 days ago - Use a multiple of 60 seconds (1 minute).
Start time between 15 and 63 days ago - Use a multiple of 300 seconds (5 minutes).
Start time greater than 63 days ago - Use a multiple of 3600 seconds (1 hour).

nested_items.name: Stat
nested_items.description: The statistic to return. It can include any CloudWatch statistic or extended statistic.

nested_items.name: Unit
nested_items.description: When you are using a Put operation, this defines what unit you want to use when storing the metric.

nested_items.name: Expression
nested_items.description: This field can contain either a Metrics Insights query, or a metric math expression to be performed on the returned data. For more information about Metrics Insights queries, see Metrics Insights query components and syntax in the Amazon CloudWatch User Guide.

nested_items.name: Label
nested_items.description: A human-readable label for this metric or expression. This is especially useful if this is an expression, so that you know what the value represents. If the metric or expression is shown in a CloudWatch dashboard widget, the label is shown. If Label is omitted, CloudWatch generates a default.

nested_items.name: ReturnData
nested_items.description: When used in GetMetricData, this option indicates whether to return the timestamps and raw data values of this metric. If you are performing this call just to do math expressions and do not also need the raw data returned, you can specify false. If you omit this, the default of true is used.

nested_items.name: Period
nested_items.description: The granularity, in seconds, of the returned data points. For metrics with regular resolution, a period can be as short as one minute (60 seconds) and must be a multiple of 60. For high-resolution metrics that are collected at intervals of less than one minute, the period can be 1, 5, 10, 30, 60, or any multiple of 60. High-resolution metrics are those metrics stored by a PutMetricData operation that includes a StorageResolution of 1 second.

nested_items.name: AccountId
nested_items.description: The ID of the account where the metrics are located.

nested_items.name: ThresholdMetricId
nested_items.description: In an alarm based on an anomaly detection model, this is the ID of the ANOMALY_DETECTION_BAND function used as the threshold for the alarm.

nested_items.name: EvaluationState
nested_items.description: If the value of this field is PARTIAL_DATA, the alarm is being evaluated based on only partial data. This happens if the query used for the alarm returns more than 10,000 metrics. For more information, see Create alarms on Metrics Insights queries.

nested_items.name: StateTransitionedTimestamp
nested_items.description: The date and time that the alarm's StateValue most recently changed.
